action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative negotiation game.

Together with another participant, you must agree on a single set of items that will be kept. Each of you has your own view of how much each item matters to you (importance). You do not know how the other participant values the items. Additionally, you are given the effort each item demands.
You may only agree on a set if the total effort of the selected items does not exceed a shared limit:

LIMIT = 3629

Here are the individual item effort values:

Item effort = {"A21": 5, "B93": 793, "A11": 21, "B33": 842, "C08": 313, "B39": 842, "B96": 631, "C85": 226, "A82": 87, "B31": 761, "B20": 230, "A60": 287, "B09": 698, "C81": 641, "B21": 882}

Here is your personal view on the importance of each item:

Item importance values = {"A21": 138, "B93": 583, "A11": 868, "B33": 822, "C08": 783, "B39": 65, "B96": 262, "C85": 121, "A82": 508, "B31": 780, "B20": 461, "A60": 484, "B09": 668, "C81": 389, "B21": 808}

Goal:

Your goal is to negotiate a shared set of items that benefits you as much as possible (i.e., maximizes total importance to YOU), while staying within the LIMIT. You are not required to make a PROPOSAL in every message - you can simply negotiate as well. All tactics are allowed!

Interaction Protocol:

You may only use the following structured formats in a message:

PROPOSAL: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Propose keeping exactly those items.
REFUSE: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Explicitly reject opponent's proposal.
ARGUMENT: {'...'}
Defend your last proposal or argue against the player's proposal.
AGREE: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Accept the opponent's proposal which ends the game.


Rules:

You may only AGREE on a proposal the other party has logged via PROPOSAL.
You may only REFUSE a proposal the other party has logged via PROPOSAL.
Total effort of any PROPOSAL or AGREE set must be ≤ LIMIT.
Do NOT reveal your hidden importance scores.
A tag in a structured format must be followed by colon and whitespace. The argument must be a python set containing 0 or more strings.
So, it must be of the form TAG: {...}
Strictly follow the interaction protocol and DO NOT write anything beyond the given structure.
The game ends when one side gives an AGREE to a PROPOSAL made by the other player.
The content in your response which can be handed to the other player has to be non-empty.
Only proposals which have been logged via the PROPOSAL format structure and which haven't been refused via REFUSE are active.
You must include the ARGUMENT format at least once somewhere in all of your messages.
action.label: context

action.content:
Okay, let's start by understanding the problem. I need to negotiate a set of items with another participant, maximizing my own total importance while keeping the total effort under 3629. The key here is that I don't know the other person's importance values, so I have to make decisions based on my own data.

First, I should calculate the total effort of all items to see which ones are feasible. Let me list out the items and their efforts:

A21:5, B93:793, A11:21, B33:842, C08:313, B39:842, B96:631, C85:226, A82:87, B31:761, B20:230, A60:287, B09:698, C81:641, B21:882.

Adding these up: 5+793=798, +21=819, +842=1661, +313=1974, +842=2816, +631=3447, +226=3673. Oh wait, that's already over 3629. So the total effort of all items is 3673, which is over the limit. So we can't take all items. Need to select a subset.

My goal is to maximize my importance. So I should prioritize items with high importance relative to their effort. Let me calculate the importance per effort ratio for each item. That way, I can pick items that give the most importance per unit of effort.

Let me list each item with importance and effort:

A21:138/5=27.6
B93:583/793≈0.735

B09:668/698≈0.957
C81:389/641≈0.607
B21:808/882≈0.916

So the highest ratios are A11 (41.33), A82 (5.839), A21 (27.6), B20 (2.004), C08 (2.502), A60 (1.686), etc. The lower ratios are B93, B39, B96, B31, B09, C81, B21, B33.

So the best items to take are A11, A82, A21, then maybe C08, B20, A60. Let's see what combination of these gives the highest total importance without exceeding 3629.

Then B31 (761) would make it 3435+761=4196 which is over. So up to C85, total effort is 3435. Then maybe add B09 (698) → 3435+698=4133, which is over. So B33 (822) is the highest. Adding B33: 943+842=1785. Then B93: 1785+793=2578. Then B31: 2578+761=3339. Then B21: 3339+882=4221 (over). So up to B31, total effort 3339. Alternatively, maybe after the initial set, add B33 (842) → 1785. Then B93 (793) → 2578. Then B96 (631) → 3209. Then B20 is already in the initial set. So maybe add B21 (882) → 3209+882=4091 (over). So no.

Alternatively, maybe after the initial set, add B33 (842) → 1785. Then B93 (793) → 2578. Then B96 (631) → 3209. Then B20 is already in. So maybe add B21 (882) → 3209+882=4091 (over). 

Alternatively, maybe after the initial set, add B33 (842) → 1785. Then B93 (793) → 2578. Then B96 (631) → 3209. Then B31 (761) → 3970 (over). 

So the maximum possible with the initial set plus some high importance items is 3435 effort. But maybe there's a better combination. Let me think. 

Alternatively, maybe instead of taking all the high ratio items, I can take some higher importance items even if their ratio is lower. For example, B33 has 822 importance. If I can fit it in, that's a big gain.

A11:868
B33:822

Then B31 (761) → 1745+761=2506. Then C08 (313) → 2506+313=2819. Then B93 (793) → 2578+793=3371. Then B09 (698) → 3371+698=4069 (over). So up to B93, total effort 3371. Then total importance would be 868+822+808+780+783+583= 868+822=1690, +808=2498, +780=3278, +783=4061, +583=4644. That's a high total. But the effort is 3612, which is under 3629. Then maybe add B96 (631) → 3612+631=4243 (over). So no. 

Alternatively, after A11, B33, B21, B31, C08, B93 (total effort 3612), that's 4644 importance. That's a good total. But maybe there's a way to add more. So the set would be A11, B33, B21, B31, C08, B93, A21. Let me check the effort: 21+842+882+761+313+793+5 = 21+842=863, +882=1745, +761=2506, +313=2819, +793=3612, +5=3617. Yes, under 3629. 

That's a good set. But I need to make sure that this is the best possible. Let me check if there's a way to include more items. For example, after adding A21, maybe add another small item. But the remaining effort is 3629-3617=12. No items with effort ≤12. So that's the maximum.
